text: what's happening today is politician
small political parties are taking just
an hour out of there campaigning to
pause and and to generally go and visit
different community groups whether
that's the Women's Institute or whether
that's the Rotary Club or Scouts or the
guides organizations who week in week
out spend their time bringing
communities together obviously election
campaigns are necessarily divisive and
they focus on the areas that we disagree
with each other on but the fact that all
of the party leaders have responded to
say actually we're going to pause just
for a second and so of course we
disagree with each other fundamentally
on lots of things but actually there's
more that unites us than divides us I
think is a really important signal and
you've had you've had a good response
from all the party leaders yeah we've
had an incredible response and you know
really beautiful events happening up in
in batley Joe's hometown all of the
candidates getting together and doing
something collectively they're raising
money at a local farm for a special baby
baby unit so it's those sorts of things
which I think you know politics is is
massively important elections are very
important for our country but we also
have to get a better balance we spend so
much time talking about the things that
we disagree with each other on and we're
very banned particularly during
elections we're very bad at actually
just pausing for a second and focusing
on those things those fundamental things
that bind you together and after this
event after this moment there's
something else which you've talked about
with Camilla and others that great to
get together what is the great get
together so the great get together
happens on the the weekend of the
anniversary of Joe's death to the 16th
17th and 18th of June and it's very
basic idea which is just asking people
to get together with their neighbors to
share food with their neighbors and
celebrate what we have in common and in
thinking about how I marked the
anniversary of Joe's death I wanted it
to reflect who she was somebody with
greats of energy energy and enthusiasm
for life I didn't want it to be a sort
of mournful not just a mournful moment
but also it felt that you know Joe's
killing the person that did it the
political extremists that did it was
trying to divide communities and I could
think of no better response than the
anniversary actually bringing
communities together and you and the
children are therefore going to have a
very very busy and in some ways I would
imagine slightly traumatic few weeks
going through all of this process how
are your coping yeah I mean for us
family you know this is something that
goes on and on is not you know
individual days can be worse and better
it's not just the the big moments and
but you know the kids here here today
and they're incredibly excited about the
great get together they're they love
planning a party they know the mum would
have loved it and it's going to get a
great breakfast afterwards yeah they're
very much looking forward to the
breakfast that's how it got out they've
got them out of bed this morning so
[Music]
you
